articles.description: Crypto is approaching a "point of inflection," say analysts at Citi, pointing to the rise of tokenization and CBDCs around the world.
articles.title: Citi Says Mass Adoption of Crypto Will Be Driven by CBDCs, Tokenization

articles.title: Matt Damon Says He Did Crypto.Com Ad Due to 'Down Year' at Clean Water Foundation

articles.title: Sky Mavis Signs Deals With Directive Games, Bali Games, Tribes, and Bowled to Build Web3 Games

articles.title: Blocktrace Builds AI Chatbot to Simplify Blockchain Transaction Tracking

articles.description: The dress, inspired by Bored Ape Yacht Club NFTs and Tam’s signature East-meets-West design aesthetic, debuted in Decentraland this week.
articles.title: Virtual Couture? Vivienne Tam’s First NFT Dress Struts Around Metaverse Fashion Week

articles.title: Pussy Riot Protest Art NFT Triggers Russian Criminal Charges

articles.title: Coin Center Says RESTRICT Act Could Be Used to Ban Bitcoin

articles.description: Nearly 77% of all y00ts NFTs have switched chains since late Monday, with DeGods still set to leave Solana for Ethereum this Friday.
articles.title: At Least $37M Worth of y00ts NFTs Migrate to Polygon From Solana in One Day

articles.description: But the regulator says that the digital asset industry is still “rife with noncompliance.”
articles.title: SEC's Gensler Insists Clear Rules for Crypto Market 'Already Exist'

articles.description: “We all need to hold ourselves to a higher standard,” declared CEO Ray Youssef.
articles.title: Paxful Vows to Refund Celsius Earn Bankruptcy Victims

articles.title: Art Blocks Debuts NFT Marketplace With Enforced Creator Royalties

articles.author: Sander Lutz
articles.description: The music label’s CEO cited “new tech initiatives” as central to the company’s future.
articles.title: Warner Music Plans to Spare Web3, AI Roles Amid Layoffs

articles.description: Despite only playing a marginal role in Metalabel's NFT collection with Gitcoin, the Ethereum founder's name led to runaway speculation.
articles.title: Degens 'Ran Away With the Narrative' on Gitcoin’s NFT Drop With Vitalik, Says Founder Kevin Owocki

articles.description: An online petition with over 1,100 public signatures calls for a six-month moratorium on further enhancements to the leading AI tool.
articles.title: Elon Musk, Steve Wozniak Urge OpenAI to Halt ChatGPT Upgrades

articles.description: Stoner comedy “Holy Smokes” scoops the top award from Roman Coppola’s decentralized film financing platform.
articles.title: Kevin Smith, Web3 Film Fund Decentralized Pictures Award $40,000 to Comedy Filmmakers

articles.description: The price of the biggest cryptocurrency by market cap is up by a significant margin—despite financial uncertainty and regulatory woes this week.
articles.title: Bitcoin Shakes Off Regulatory Crackdown, Jumps Nearly 6% in 24 Hours

articles.author: Alys Key
articles.description: The Terra co-founder Do Kwon and his associate Han Chang Joon will first face charges in Montenegro for allegedly using forged documents.
articles.title: US, South Korea Seek Terra Co-Founder Do Kwon’s Extradition

articles.author: Ryan Gladwin
articles.description: A recent upgrade to meme coin SafeMoon’s smart contract saw the project robbed of $8.9 million—and then stolen again.
articles.title: Meme Coin Project SafeMoon Rekt for $9M Due to Public Burn Bug

articles.description: A new bill seeks to introduce restrictions on Bitcoin mining activities in Texas, while also reducing incentives for the industry.
articles.title: New Texas Senate Bill Seeks to Slash Bitcoin Mining Incentives

articles.description: Tokens powering popular liquid staking protocols for Ethereum, like Lido Finance and Rocket Pool, enjoyed a heady run on Wednesday.
articles.title: Ethereum Staking Tokens Jump Double Digits as Shanghai Upgrade Gets a Date

articles.author: Stacy Elliott
articles.description: The charges against Binance are stiff, and the penalties could be business-ending. Here’s what you need to know.
articles.title: What the Binance CFTC Lawsuit Means for Crypto

articles.description: An AI developer wrote a simple script to replace the iconic Apple assistant with ChatGPT. The internet rejoiced.
articles.title: Siri, You’re Fired!

articles.description: LDK, the Lightning Network implementation being developed by the Jack Dorsey-backed Spiral, has got big plans to improve the way payments can be made on Bitcoin.
articles.title: Jack Dorsey-Backed Spiral Plots Course for Mainstream Adoption of Bitcoin’s Lightning Network

articles.author: Andrew Cohen
articles.description: Formula 1’s crypto presence shrank in recent months, but the pool is growing again as Kraken teams up with Williams Racing.
articles.title: F1 Team Adds Crypto Sponsor in Kraken After FTX, Tezos Exits

articles.description: Cloud-based infrastructure can save costs—but may also be an attractive avenue for criminals.
articles.title: North Korean Hackers Use Cloud Mining Services to Launder Dirty Crypto

articles.author: Jason Nelson
articles.description: The software giant aims to use artificial intelligence to beef up its security measures, including instant threat detection.
articles.title: Microsoft Unveils Security Copilot, a Cybersecurity Tool That Uses Generative AI

articles.author: André Beganski
articles.description: The Justice Department is currently appealing a judge’s approval of a deal that allows Binance’s U.S. affiliate to acquire Voyager’s distressed assets.
articles.title: CFTC Lawsuit Won't Affect Binance's Acquisition of Voyager, Experts Say

articles.description: Paul Grewal is the Chief Legal Officer at Coinbase and a former U.S. magistrate judge in Northern California. He gave Dan Roberts and Stacy Elliott his candid takes on Sam Bankman-Fried and FTX, the SEC's crackdown on staking, the sanctioning of Tornado Cash, and more alpha on how Coinbase is approaching the current unfriendly US regulatory environment. Watch and make sure to subscribe to the gm podcast on Apple or Spotify.
articles.title: gm: Coinbase's Top Lawyer Gets Real on SEC

articles.author: Liam J. Kelly,Stacy Elliott
articles.description: The FTX founder now faces a total of 13 criminal charges in connection with the collapse of the crypto exchange.
articles.title: Sam Bankman-Fried Charged With Bribing Chinese Government Officials

articles.author: Ryan Gladwin
articles.description: Binance CEO CZ responded to the CFTC’s lawsuit, stating that its complaint "appears to contain an incomplete recitation of facts."
articles.title: BNB Slips Over 5% Following Binance CFTC Lawsuit

articles.author: Andrew Asmakov
articles.description: Zero-knowledge proofs developed by Ethereum scaling firm StarkWare are now making a debut on the Bitcoin blockchain.
articles.title: Tested on Ethereum, StarkWare’s Zero-Knowledge Proofs Are Now Live on Bitcoin

articles.author: Ryan Gladwin
articles.description: Recent Disney layoffs have seen its metaverse unit of 50 completely cut from the company while the head of the team remains.
articles.title: Disney Cuts Metaverse Unit Amid Company-Wide Layoffs: Report

articles.description: A month after launching Chiliz Chain 2.0, the project’s CEO is eager to get more developers and projects to start building on it.
articles.title: It’s Been a Month—Who’s Building on Chiliz Chain 2.0?

articles.description: After deploying its layer-2 solution last month, Coinbase is now calling for builders to churn up activity on Base.
articles.title: ‘Flatcoin’ Builders Respond to Coinbase Call to Deploy on Layer-2 Network Base

articles.author: Jason Nelson
articles.description: An engineer is tapping artificial intelligence to revolutionize how documents are read and how information is gathered.
articles.title: New AI Tool Named for Warren Buffett Makes Quick Work of Corporate Filings

articles.description: Brands like Dolce & Gabbana and Coach will display their digital wares in an event spanning three metaverse platforms. Here's how it will work.
articles.title: Metaverse Fashion Week 2023 Goes Multi-Platform in Push for Interoperability

articles.author: Jason Nelson
articles.description: The exchange says it still wants to work with regulators to establish clear guidelines.
articles.title: ‘Unexpected and Disappointing’: Binance Reacts to CFTC Lawsuit

articles.author: Kate Irwin
articles.description: Nvidia caters to gamers, but also sells hardware explicitly designed for crypto mining. Now its CTO is slamming crypto and pushing AI instead.
articles.title: Nvidia Says Crypto Adds Nothing to Society, Despite Profiting From Mining

articles.author: Andrew Hayward
articles.description: The Ethereum creator was described as a “man of culture” after setting the gas limit on the network’s first-ever transaction to "69042."
articles.title: Vitalik Buterin Sends Hidden Message in First Polygon zkEVM Transaction

articles.author: Liam J. Kelly,Andrew Hayward
articles.description: Luxury fashion brand Gucci is taking further steps into Web3 with Yuga Labs, with first plans set to get underway this week.
articles.title: Gucci Reveals Metaverse Tie-Up With Bored Ape Creator Yuga Labs

articles.description: Rotten Tomatoes founder Patrick Lee, who has led companies at the intersection of technology and entertainment from Web1 to Web3, spoke to Decrypt's Sander Lutz at Outer Edge LA about the current state of decentralized gaming, film and television.
articles.title: The Founder of Rotten Tomatoes Says Web3 Entertainment Isn’t Nearly Entertaining Enough Yet

articles.description: Gnosis first launched in 2015 as a decentralized prediction market built on Ethereum. Now it's a DAO, a multi-sig wallet, a staking chain, and a vibrant community with its own GNO governance token. Co-founder and COO Friederike Ernst talked to Dan Roberts and Stacy Elliott about the careful evolution of Gnosis, decentralization impostors, account abstraction, DeFi UX failures, why Ethereum is the "Manhattan of crypto," and much more. Watch and make sure to subscribe to the gm podcast on Apple or Spotify.
articles.title: gm: How Gnosis Has Endured and Evolved

articles.description: Justin Aversano, best known for his high-selling "Twin Flames" NFT photo series, joined Decrypt’s Andrew Hayward ahead of the upcoming L.A. exhibition for his new Ethereum NFT project "Smoke and Mirrors." He shared the wild inspiration behind the tarot-themed collection, and why—despite his growing profile—he opted not to exhibit at a major brand-name gallery.
articles.title: Justin Aversano's Inspiration for Tarot-Themed NFT Photo Series 'Smoke and Mirrors'

articles.description: Former "Call of Duty" developer Rob Bowling, now head of Midnight Society Studio, checked in with Decrypt's Kate Irwin at GDC and shared some behind-the-scenes statistics on how players are enjoying "Deadrop." The game saw 90,000 player hours over the weekend, with 97 minutes average play time per player, and their community size tripled in just a few days.
articles.title: Midnight Society’s Rob Bowling Talks Deadrop Launch and Working With Dr. Disrespect

articles.description: On this panel from NFT Paris 2023 moderated by Decrypt's Dan Roberts, Web3 leads from some of the largest consumer and tech brands discuss their NFT strategies. Marc Mathieu of Salesforce, Tim Walther of VW Group, Eva Assayag of Panerai, and Samir Addamine of Absolute Labs joined the panel.
articles.title: Big Brands Get Serious About NFTs: Salesforce, VW, Panerai, Absolute Labs at NFT Paris

articles.description: At NFT Paris 2023, Decrypt’s Stephen Graves moderated a discussion about NFTs and the entertainment industry with Warner Bros’ NFT head Josh Hackbarth, CyberBrokers founder Josie Bellini, NFT Now founder Matt Medved and Dave Broome, CEO of Orange Comet, which has produced NFTs for Anthony Hopkins and The Walking Dead.
articles.title: NFT Entertainment Revolution: Warner Bros, Orange Comet, CyberBrokers and NFT Now at NFT Paris

articles.description: Knights Who Say Nah co-founder and project lead Nick Richey chats with Decrypt's Jason Nelson inside the group's armory of artifacts, shows off a historic Japanese tanto sword, and discusses why the preservation of historical artifacts is the best use case for NFTs.
articles.title: Step Inside the Armory of the NFT Collective 'Knights Who Say Nah'

articles.description: Voltz Labs Co-founder and CEO Simon Jones talks to Decrypt's Jason Nelson at ETH Denver about using DeFi for interest rate swaps, the unfriendly regulatory environment in the US right now, emerging economies becoming crypto hubs, and the "cartoonishly large" market opportunity for DeFi.
articles.title: Voltz Labs CEO: DeFi Innovation Is Moving Offshore Because of US Regulatory Severity

articles.description: MoonPay CEO Ivan Soto-Wright talked to Decrypt's Liam Kelly at NFT Paris about how NFTs are clearly not "waning," how MoonPay works with brands like Puma and Nike to manage their Web3 plays and smart contracts, and how NFTs and crypto will go mainstream when they can integrate in our daily lives—and his prediction that brands will drive that.
articles.title: MoonPay CEO: Next Phase of NFT Adoption Will Come From 'Brands You Love in Your Everyday Life'

articles.description: Brandon Potts, a principal at Web3 VC firm Framework Ventures, spoke to Decrypt's Jason Nelson at ETH Denver about his investment focus, his outlook on crypto regulation right now, and why he's optimistic for the industry even amid the bear market and recent regulatory actions.
articles.title: Framework Ventures Is 'Optimistic That Regulators Are Much More Educated' About Crypto Than in Past

articles.description: Fanny Lakoubay, the founder of art advisory and agency LAL Art, talked to Decrypt's Liam Kelly at NFT Paris about what LAL Art does, how it works with artists, museums, directors, and galleries, and why artists in Web3 have to "reinvent themselves every six months."
articles.title: Why LAL Art Has 'No Interest In Just Putting the Traditional Art Market on the Blockchain'

articles.description: Anjali Young, the co-founder of Abridged and Collab.Land, talked to Decrypt's Jason Nelson at ETH Denver about the origins of Collab.Land and says it erupted thanks to Covid, which created not just new interest in crypto but the need for better tools for DAO member collaboration.
articles.title: Collab.Land Grew 'Because of Covid' Creating Need for DAO Tools: Co-founder Anjali Young

articles.description: Visual artist Mat Collishaw, who uses mixed media to explore beauty, is about to launch Heterosis, a metaverse art experience with dynamic NFTs hosted by OG.Art. He spoke to Decrypt's Dan Roberts at NFT Paris about how he came to Web3.
articles.title: Artist Mat Collishaw is Exploring the 'Mutability' of NFTs

articles.description: Samir Addamine, Co-founder and CEO of Web3 CRM software company Absolute Labs, told Decrypt's Dan Roberts at NFT Paris that big consumer brands are rushing to figure out crypto wallets and how they can harness them for their marketing purposes and to deepen ties with customers.
articles.title: Absolute Labs CEO: Big Brands Are Trying to Understand and Harness Crypto Wallets

articles.description: Pseudonymous NFT collector Gmoney talks to Decrypt's Dan Roberts at NFT Paris about his Web3 luxury brand 9dcc, big brands getting into NFTs, the debate over creator royalty fees, and what will come next to the space.
articles.title: NFT Collector Gmoney: 'Marketplaces Have Nothing to Trade Without Creators'

articles.description: Dispatch is a new Web3 marketing, messaging, and ad tech tool from IEX Group, which also owns the IEX exchange fighting high-frequency trading and made famous in the book "Flash Boys" by Michael Lewis. Dispatch head of product Sean Spector sat down with Decrypt's Liam Kelly at NFT Paris to talk about Dispatch's product vision and why Web2 companies are jumping into Web3.
articles.title: Head of Product for IEX's Dispatch: 'We See Tokens as the Social Graph of Web3'

articles.description: Chris Gonsalves, CEO of esports tournament platform Community Gaming, talks to Decrypt's Jason Nelson at ETH Denver about Web3 gaming, his past stint at ConsenSys, and using smart contracts to get gamers paid instantly. Community Gaming has also just announced the 3XP Gaming Expo, June 8-9 in Pasadena, CA.
articles.title: Community Gaming CEO: Ethereum Smart Contracts Can Solve 'Pain Points' of Gamers Getting Paid

articles.description: Neal Stephenson coined the term “metaverse” in his seminal 1992 sci-fi hit novel “Snow Crash.” Now he’s helming a metaverse blockchain company called Lamina1 and advocating for one free and open metaverse. He spoke to Dan Roberts and Stephen Graves at length about what he got right and wrong in “Snow Crash,” goggles and flat screens, Big Tech, NFTs and digital ownership, and more. Watch and make sure to subscribe to the gm podcast on Apple or Spotify.
articles.title: gm: Neal Stephenson Maps Out the Metaverse

articles.description: Omer Amsel, head of Web3 products at crypto custody and settlement provider Fireblocks, told Decrypt's Jason Nelson at ETH Denver about why crypto market cycles are best for building, how Fireblocks is focused on providing "picks and shovels," and why the company still believes in the long-term promise of Web3.
articles.title: Fireblocks Is Laser-Focused on the Picks and Shovels: Web3 Products Lead at ETH Denver
Unstoppable Domains offering AI-generated avatars that can turn into Polygon NFTs. Is that still a thing?

articles.author: Ronaldo Marquez
articles.description:
Injective, a decentralized exchange and layer-2 protocol has announced the release of Cascade, the first-ever Solana Sealevel Virtual Machine (SVM) rollup for the inter-Blockchain Communication (IBC) ecosystem supported by Cosmos. 
 
According to the announcement, this new integration will bring the SVM into the broader Cosmos ecosystem, a decentralized network of interconnected blockchains that enables interoperability between different networks. 
 
 
 
What Is Solana’s Cascade And How Does It Work?
 
The launch of Cascade by Injective could represent a significant development for the company, as it enables access to the large and growing Solana developer ecosystem, valued at over $9 billion with the Cosmos ecosystem. 
 
According to the announcement, Cascade was made possible through con…
articles.title: Injective Unveils Cascade: The First Interchain Solana SVM Rollup

articles.author: BtcCasey
articles.description:
BitGo has introduced a new security solution to protect Ordinals inscriptions from accidental transfers and enable users to inscribe their own content onto Bitcoin.
BitGo, a leading provider of digital asset custody solutions, has introduced a new security solution for protecting Bitcoin Ordinals inscriptions from accidental transfers, also enabling users to inscribe their own content onto the Bitcoin blockchain. 
Ordinals inscriptions allow people to inscribe text, images, and videos directly on the Bitcoin blockchain. However, given that they are still a relatively new technology for Bitcoin, most wallets cannot yet easily receive, send or store them, which puts potentially high-value inscriptions at risk of being accidentally transferred or sent to mining fees.
BitGo's new solution enab…
articles.title: BitGo Introduces Solution To Securely Store Ordinal Inscriptions On

articles.author: BtcCasey
articles.description:
Fold is aiming at bringing its bitcoin rewards card product to users around the world through this expansionary partnership.
Fold, a Bitcoin rewards company, has announced that it will collaborate with Visa, which will become the exclusive global network partner for Fold's prepaid debit and credit products in North America, Europe, and Latin American countries. The move aims to expand the reach of the first Visa co-branded Bitcoin rewards debit card launched in the spring of 2020 to more Fold users worldwide. The announcement comes as nearly $1 billion in transactions have gone through Fold since the launch of the Fold Visa Debit Card, and users have been rewarded over $30 million in bitcoin since the launch of the app.
Fold CEO Will Reeves said, "In order to meet the growing demand for Bi…
articles.title: Fold Announces Exclusive Global Partnership With Visa

articles.author: Shaurya Malwa
articles.description: Custody provider BitGo has released a security tool for protecting Bitcoin Ordinals Inscriptions from accidental transfers.
articles.title: Crypto Custody Firm BitGo Releases Security Features Aimed at Bitcoin Ordinals

articles.description: The Web3 domain provider is helping users enhance their digital identities through AI avatars that can be minted as NFTs on Polygon.
articles.title: Unstoppable Domains Launches AI-Generated Avatars

articles.author: Amitoj Singh
articles.description: Crypto rewards app Fold and Visa (V) have expanded their ongoing partnership to North America, Europe and Latin America and the Caribbean, an announcement said.
articles.title: Visa and Bitcoin Rewards App Fold Expand Partnership to New Regions

articles.author: Solomon Oladipupo
articles.description:
Kraken, one of the longest-running cryptocurrency exchanges in the industry, has filed a pre-registration with the Canada’s Ontario Securities Commission (OSC). The move is part of the US-based digital asset firm’s efforts to become a registered Restricted Dealer across all regions in Canada.

The cryptocurrency exchange announced the development in a statement shared with Finance Magnates on Thursday. It noted that it took to the action in order “to comply with the Canadian Securities Administrators’ recently enhanced investor protection guidance."

Oh, Canada! We’ve got news 🇨🇦Kraken users will be happy to learn that we have taken the necessary steps required by regul…
articles.title: Kraken Files Pre-Registration with Canada’s Ontario Regulator

articles.author: Jack Schickler
articles.description: Proposals to stop social media stars promoting unlicensed companies were approved by the National Assembly Thursday.
articles.title: French Crypto Influencer Ban Will Harm Country’s Attractiveness, Industry Group Says

articles.author: Finance Magnates Staff
articles.description:
Blockchain technology has been touted as a solution to the issue of financial exclusion, promising a more inclusive and accessible financial system. However, there is a growing concern that the implementation of blockchain technology could backfire spectacularly, further exacerbating the already existing technological gap while also aggravating financial exclusion and unbanked population.

While blockchain technology has the potential to create a decentralized financial system, the reality is that the tech gap is still significant. There are still many people who lack access to the internet, mobile phones, or other technologies required to use blockchain-based financial services. This creates a significant barrier to entry for t…
articles.title: The Dark Side of the Blockchain

articles.author: Jamie Crawley
articles.description: The company's request for a three-week extension of creditor protection to last until April 23 was also granted.
articles.title: Crypto Exchange Zipmex's Restructuring Plan Approved by Singapore Court

articles.title: FTX Founder Sam Bankman-Fried Pleads Not Guilty to Latest Bribery Charge

articles.author: Eliman Dambell
articles.description:
Monero climbed for a third consecutive session on Thursday, as the token moved marginally closer to a six-week high. This rise in price comes despite the fact that the global market cap mostly consolidated, and is trading just 0.50% higher as of writing. As for LINK, chainlink bulls have so far failed to break out of a key resistance point.
 
Monero (XMR)
 
Monero (XMR) was one of Thursday’s notable gainers, with prices climbing for a third consecutive session.
 
XMR/USD rose to a high of $163.19 earlier in today’s session, which comes a day after the token fell to a low of $155.83.
 
As a result of the move, XMR moved towards last Sunday’s high at $166.07, which was its strongest point since February 20.
 
 
Looking at the chart, today’s move came as monero surged above a recent resistance level at $160.00.
 
Overall, the surge came as the 14-day relative strength index (RSI) collided with its own ceiling at the 55.00 mark.
 
At the time of writing, the index is tracking at 54.86, which is its highest reading this week.
 
 
Chainlink (LINK)
 
On the other hand, chainlink (LINK) was mostly lower on Thursday, as the token failed to move above a key price point.
 
LINK/USD slipped to a low at $7.25 in today’s session — this comes after prices hit an earlier peak of $7.53.
 
Today’s high saw chainlink move towards its ceiling at $7.55, however bulls were unable to secure a breakout.
 
 
From the chart, it appears that the failure to move beyond $7.55 coincided with the RSI falling at a resistance of its own.
 
As of writing, the index is tracking at 53.16, which is below the aforementioned ceiling at 55.00.
 
Overall, LINK is now trading at $7.32, with sentiment in today’s session now mostly bearish.
 
Register your email here to get weekly price analysis updates sent to your inbox:
 
Do you expect chainlink to move higher in the coming days? Let us know your thoughts in the comments.
articles.title: Biggest Movers: XMR Nears 6-Week High, as LINK Falls Near a Resistance Level

articles.author: Jamie Crawley
articles.description: The court also ruled that the 3AC liquidators' service of a subpoena to Davies via Twitter complied with due process.
articles.title: Three Arrows Capital's Kyle Davies Ordered to Respond to Subpoena Within 2 Weeks

articles.author: Julian Liniger
articles.description:
Trust in central and commercial banks is eroding quickly. The internet and social media are oil in the fire and Bitcoin is the extinguisher.
 
         
         
         
         
    
This is an opinion editorial by Julian Liniger, the co-founder and CEO of Relai, a Swiss-based, bitcoin-only investment app.
‘Trust Us, Bro’ As The Only Tool Left
Banking only works when there is trust. It’s fundamentally based on the belief that the banking system is strong and resilient enough to protect your money. But this trust-based system has shown that the rich and powerful benefit from this protection. As we saw in 2008 and since, the regular taxpayer is paying the bill.
It’s ironic that Credit Suisse, which emerged as one of the winners of the 2008 financial crisis, is among the first banks to b…
articles.title: There’s No Reason To Trust Banks And, Thanks To Bitcoin, We Don’t Have To

articles.author: Kevin Reynolds
articles.description: Sometimes they really are out to get you. The government’s regulatory attack on crypto is an abuse of power that risks sending a vital industry overseas, to no gain for consumer protections.
articles.title: CoinDesk Editorial: It Sure Looks Like the U.S. Is Trying to Kill Crypto

articles.author: Hououin Kyouma
articles.description:
On-chain data shows the Bitcoin open interest has been rapidly going up with the price, a sign that a long squeeze may be brewing in the market.
 
Bitcoin Open Interest Has Seen Sharp Rise Recently
 
As pointed out by an analyst in a CryptoQuant post, the funding rates are also highly positive right now. The “open interest” is an indicator that measures the total amount of Bitcoin futures contracts that are currently open on derivative exchanges. This metric accounts for both short and long contracts.
 
When the value of this metric displays a rise, it means BTC investors are opening up new positions in the futures market right now. Since more derivative positions generally also imply an increase in leverage in the market, this kind of trend can lead to the asset’s price turning more volat…
articles.title: Bitcoin Open Interest Shoots Up With Price Rise, Long Squeeze Brewing?

articles.description: The startup will have a second close in the coming weeks for the round at a $1.4 billion valuation.
articles.title: Crypto Hardware Wallet Maker Ledger Raises Most of $109M Round: Bloomberg

articles.author: Lubomir Tassev
articles.description:
Before extradition, Terraform Labs founder Do Kwon will first have to stand trial in Montenegro for traveling on a fake passport, according to his lawyer in the country. The fugitive crypto entrepreneur may also have to serve time in prison before he is extradited from the Balkan nation, its justice minister indicated.
 
Alleged South Korean Crypto Fraudster Do Kwon Stays in the Balkans for Now, Officials Say
 
Kwon Do-Hyung, the CEO of the company behind crashed stablecoin terrausd and cryptocurrency luna who is better known as Do Kwon, will face trial in Montenegro. He was arrested there on March 23 while trying to leave for Dubai using a false Costa Rican passport.
 
Terraform Labs co-founder’s trial for using forged personal documents “must be completed first” before he can be extradit…
articles.title: Do Kwon to Stand Trial in Montenegro, May Serve Time Before Extradition

articles.author: Ian Allison
articles.description: Kraken has filed a pre-registration undertaking with the Ontario Securities Commission as it works towards becoming a registered Restricted Dealer in Canada.
articles.title: Crypto Exchange Kraken Commits to Tougher Rules Required by Canada

articles.author: Dalmas Ngetich
articles.description:
Tezos, a self-amending proof-of-stake blockchain, has activated its 13th core protocol upgrade, Mumbai, introducing Smart Rollups, a Layer-2 scaling solution, for faster transaction processing speeds.
 
Tezos Introduces Smart Rollups Via Mumbai
 
Smart Rollups enable decentralized applications (dapps) to utilize Tezos’ resources to process a high volume of transactions while ensuring the integrity and security of the rollup. This approach will allow the blockchain to process more than one million transactions per second, all without sacrificing decentralization.
 
 
Tezos aims to enhance its scalability and performance with Smart Rollups. Notably, the Mumbai upgrade brings several technical features that make it a developer-friendly platform. 
 
There is a WebAssembly (WASM) execution envi…
articles.title: Tezos Activates Mumbai, Introduces Smart Rollups
